skill.name: ml-expert
skill.description: Implement machine learning solutions including model architectures, training pipelines, optimization strategies, and performance improvements. This skill spawns a specialist ML implementation agent...
skill.summary: Implement machine learning solutions including model architectures, training pipelines, optimization...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate ML implementation skill. All 79 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified Python code examples (backticks in string literals) as shell commands, and benign ML terminology as cryptographic/network threats. The skill operates in plan mode with user approval for all changes. No malicious patterns, credential theft, or exfiltration behavior detected.

low_findings.title: Standard development tool capabilities
low_findings.description: The skill can read, write, and edit files in the project directory. It can also execute bash commands for testing and validation. These are standard capabilities for a development tool but could theoretically be misused if the agent prompt were compromised. The skill uses plan mode for safety, requiring user approval before applying changes.

content.value_statement: Transform ML research into production code. Get expert implementation of neural architectures, training pipelines, and performance optimizations with comprehensive testing and validation.
actual_capabilities: Implement neural network architectures from research papers and specifications
Build training pipelines with gradient handling, mixed precision, and checkpointing
Optimize model performance for inference speed, memory efficiency, and numerical stability
Write comprehensive unit tests with 90%+ coverage and integration tests
Apply PyTorch best practices including proper module registration and autograd handling
Integrate with ml-training-debugger for diagnosing and fixing training issues
limitations: Does not provide pretrained model weights or trained parameters
Cannot access external GPUs or cloud compute resources for actual training
Limited to generating and validating code; does not execute training loops itself
Requires reference papers or clear specifications for custom architecture implementation

use_cases.title: Implement Research Papers
use_cases.description: Transform academic papers into working PyTorch implementations with proper testing and documentation

use_cases.title: Optimize Training Code
use_cases.description: Fix training issues and optimize model performance for faster inference and lower memory usage

use_cases.title: Build ML Pipelines
use_cases.description: Create production-ready training pipelines with checkpointing, validation, and monitoring

prompt_templates.title: Basic Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a [architecture name] model in PyTorch with [n] layers and [d] hidden dimensions. Include proper initialization and docstrings.

prompt_templates.title: Paper Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the [paper name] architecture from this paper specification. Target parameter count: [X]M. Framework: PyTorch. Include tests.

prompt_templates.title: Training Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complete training pipeline for my model. Include: mixed precision training, gradient checkpointing, learning rate scheduling, checkpoint saving, and validation loop.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Tuning
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize my model for real-time inference. Current latency is [X]ms. Target: [Y]ms. Apply torch.compile, operator fusion, and memory optimizations.

output_examples.input: Implement a transformer encoder with 8 layers, 512 hidden dimensions, and 8 attention heads in PyTorch
output: Created TransformerEncoder class with proper Module registration
Implemented positional encoding with learned embeddings
Added multi-head attention with scaled dot-product attention
Included layer normalization and residual connections
Added usage example with synthetic data

output_examples.input: Build a training loop for image classification with AdamW optimizer, cosine annealing, and mixed precision
output: Created Trainer class with configurable optimizer and scheduler
Implemented mixed precision training with GradScaler
Added learning rate warmup and cosine decay schedule
Included checkpoint saving and best model tracking
Validated on synthetic data: loss decreases correctly

best_practices: Provide reference papers or clear specifications when requesting custom architectures
Specify constraints upfront including parameter budget, memory limits, and speed requirements
Request tests and documentation in the same prompt for complete, verifiable deliverables
anti_patterns: Asking for implementation without reviewing the plan first breaks plan mode safety guarantees
Requesting changes to production code without updating corresponding unit tests
Skipping validation by not running the provided test suite before deployment

faq.question: What ML frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Primary support for PyTorch. Custom implementations work with standard tensor operations and can adapt to other frameworks.

faq.question: What performance targets can I request?
faq.answer: Specify parameter counts, memory limits (VRAM), and latency requirements. Agent optimizes within constraints.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Works with ml-training-debugger for issue fixes and code-analyzer for quality review.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only accesses your project files. No external data transmission occurs during implementation.

faq.question: Why does it ask before making changes?
faq.answer: Plan mode ensures transparency. You review and approve all code changes before they are applied.

faq.question: How is this different from Codex?
faq.answer: Provides specialized ML expertise with structured methodology, testing standards, and optimization knowledge.
